New Records: New Zealand successfully defended a total of 172 to win by 5 wickets with 160 balls remaining.
Mitchell Santner contributed with 2/22 in 10 overs, showing his spin capabilities.
Key Match Events: Daryl Mitchell's diving catch to dismiss Chapman was a pivotal moment in the match.
New Zealand's rapid opening stand of 86 in 13 overs set the tone for their chase.
Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand elected to field first after winning the toss.
Kane Williamson highlighted the challenge of Sri Lanka's top order but expressed confidence in his team's ability to adapt.
Post-Match Reflections: Kane Williamson praised the team's resilience and noted the importance of the win ahead of the semi-finals.
Trent Boult expressed satisfaction with his performance and the team's ability to handle challenging conditions.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played under clear skies with no interruptions, allowing the full 50 overs to be played.
New Zealand's victory significantly impacted Pakistan's chances of qualifying for the semi-finals.
Others: The match was the 41st of the ICC Cricket World Cup 2023-24 season.
The umpires for the match were Adrian Holdstock, Joel Wilson, and Richard Kettleborough.
